0.text: Here is how we can analyze the auto insurance data:

analysis.1:
The key trends and patterns I see in the auto insurance expenditure data:

- Average expenditures on auto insurance have increased year-over-year in most years from 2003-2021. There are a few years of small declines, but the overall trajectory is upwards.

- The rate of increase has fluctuated year-to-year, ranging from around 1-2% up to 6-7% in some years like 2016 and 2017.

- The largest percent increases tended to occur after years of slower growth or declines, potentially as rates re-adjusted upwards.

- In 2020, expenditures declined around 2-2.5% likely due to the COVID-19 pandemic and disruptions to driving/insurance. But they rebounded in 2021.

Key statistics:
- Average expenditure in most recent year (2021): $1061.54
- Highest expenditure: $1071.74 in 2019 
- Percent change range: -2.4% (2020) to +6.7% (2017)
- Average annual percent change (2012-2021): Around 3.2%

So in summary, auto insurance costs have trended upwards over the past decade-plus, with some fluctuations in the rate of increase year-to-year, and a temporary pandemic-related dip in 2020 before resuming increases.
